titleStmt.title: Count Hanlan's downfall, or, A true and exact account of the killing that arch traytor and Tory, Redmon ô Hanlan by Art ô Hanlan, one of his own party, on the 25 day of April, 1681, near the Eight Mile Bridge, in the county of Down being the copy of a letter writ by a country gentleman (now in Dublin) to a person of quality (his friend) in the country.
titleStmt.author: Whitaker, Edward.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Joseph Ray ... for William Winter ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
